            </h3></header><p>D端rr AG (details in section 2.1) maintains our social media presence. Visiting our social media pages results in a variety of data being processed. As the operator of these social media pages, we are the joint data controllers, together with the network operators, in accordance with Art. 4(7) GDPR.</p><p><strong>a) Which social media platforms do we have a presence on? </strong></p><p>We have a social media presence on the following networks:</p><ul><li>Facebook: Facebook Ireland Limited, 4 Grand Canal Square, Dublin 2, Ireland (<strong>Facebook</strong>, details in section 3.2);</li><li>Instagram: Facebook Ireland Limited, 4 Grand Canal Square, Dublin 2, Ireland (<strong>Instagram</strong>, details in section 3.3);</li><li>LinkedIn: LinkedIn Ireland Unlimited Company, Wilton Place, Dublin 2, Ireland (<strong>LinkedIn</strong>, details in section 3.4);</li><li>YouTube: YouTube LLC, 901 Cherry Avenue, San Bruno, CA 94066, USA, represented by Google Ireland Limited, Gordon House, Barrow Street, Dublin 4, Ireland (<strong>YouTube</strong>, details in section 3.5);</li><li>Twitter: Twitter International Company, One Cumberland Place, Fenian Street, Dublin 2, D02 AX07, Ireland (<strong>Twitter</strong>, details in section 3.6);</li><li>Xing: New Work SE, Am Strandkai 1, 20457 Hamburg, Germany (<strong>Xing</strong>, details in section 3.7);</li><li>Kununu: NEW WORK AUSTRIA, XING kununu Prescreen GmbH, Schottenring 2-6, 1010 Vienna, Austria (<strong>Kununu</strong>, details in section 3.8).</li></ul></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98531"><p><strong>b) What purposes are my data processed for? </strong></p><p>D端rr maintains a presence on social media platforms to give you an in-depth insight into our offering and our everyday business activities with the aim of arousing your interest in us as your (future) business partner or as your (future) employer.</p><p></p><ul><li><strong>Information made public:</strong> In individual cases, D端rr can only access the information in your profile that you have made public (for example, your user name, the content published in your profile, and the actions that you take in relation to it, e.g. if you like or share a post). You can find out which information this is under your profile settings. In addition, you have the option to stop following our social media presence. If you do so, your profile will no longer appear in the list of fans (linked contacts) on this social media presence.</li><li><strong>Making contact: </strong>We process your data if you make contact with us via our social media presence, e.g. if you send us a direct message via the network or if you like, share, or comment on one of our posts or if you mention us in a post or if we like, share, or comment on one of your posts. We will use your data (such as your first name, last name, message) so that our customer support can respond to your request.</li><li><strong>Analysis of usage behavior: </strong>We use analysis technologies provided by the network operators to carry out statistical evaluations of the response to our social media presence from visitors. This enables us to adjust and optimize our offering to correspond with visitors interests. For this purpose, the network operators store cookies and similar technologies, e.g. pixels, during visits to our social media pages. Many network operators make use of third-party services (e.g. Google Analytics) for this purpose. Registered users can be identified by the network operators. As well as producing the statistics about page use that have been referred to, this processing also helps to improve the advertising displayed by the network operators via the network and on third-party pages.</li></ul><p>The legal basis for the data processing is Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR and our legitimate interest in answering your inquiry, offering you services and products that correspond with your interests, and improving our offering and our social media presence, and adapting it to the needs and interests of our visitors. The same applies if you send us your request via a form on the network. You can find details of processing in the context of CRM in section 4.4. If social media providers store cookies or similar technologies on our website for analysis or marketing purposes, we will obtain your consent. For details, please refer to section 2.3.</p><p><strong>Right to object </strong></p><p><strong>In section 1.3 we explain your right to object to the processing of your data on the basis of Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR. </strong></p><p><strong>Note: Processing by network operators and third parties: </strong>Please note that network operators also process the data that you have voluntarily made publicly available when you visit and use our social media presence (e.g. reading, commenting on, or liking a post). In addition, network operators also process log data (e.g. your IP address, browser and device information, most recently visited page, location, time stamp, settings). If you have logged into the network using your own profile, the network can assign these data to your profile. Partners of the network operator and third parties can also store cookies via social media networks to provide services to companies that advertise on the networks. This processing is based on the general terms and conditions and privacy policy of the network in question. You will find links to these below. We cannot track or influence processing of this kind.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98530"><p><strong>c) Facelift social media management tool </strong></p><p>To manage our social media presence effectively, we use Facelift Cloud from Facelift Brand Building Technologies GmbH, Gerhofstrasse 19, 20354 Hamburg, Germany (<strong>Facelift</strong>).</p><p>Facelift Cloud is a platform that supports our processes and enables us to take digital marketing measures with a focus on social media. Facelift Cloud allows content to be added to our presence on social media networks such as Facebook, Instagram, Xing, LinkedIn, Pinterest, YouTube and Twitter, the use of the content by visitors to be evaluated, the social media presence to be adapted to users needs, and the presence to be moderated. Facelift provides us with evaluations of the use of our presence on different social media channels. The analysis data are anonymized by Facelift from the start. Facelift stores the messages sent to us via our social media presence for a maximum of one year. For these purposes, Facelift processes the personal data, referred to in section 3.1 b), belonging to users of and visitors to our social media presence as our processor.</p><p>This data processing is based on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR. We have a legitimate interest in analyzing the use of our social media presence and in rapid and efficient communication in order to improve our customer service, the customer experience on our social media presence, and our advertising.</p><p>You can find more information about data protection at Facelift Brand Building Technologies GmbH at: <a href="https://www.facelift-bbt.com/en/imprint" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.facelift-bbt.com/en/imprint</a></p><p><strong>Right to object </strong></p><p><strong>In section 1.3 we explain your right to object to the processing of your data on the basis of Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR. </strong></p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98529"><p><strong>d) Meltwater social media management platform </strong></p><p>We use the all-in-one platform from Meltwater Deutschland GmbH, Rotherstrasse 22, 10245 Berlin, Germany (<strong>Meltwater</strong>), which enables us to manage our social media presence and, at the same time, to monitor traditional online media. The tool analyzes our activities and provides us with information about PR reports relating to us. Meltwater searches publicly available information on our behalf from the following sources among others: Twitter, blogs, forums, Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, Reddit, evaluations, Pinterest, TikTok (you can find information about our social media presence in section 3.1 a)). Meltwater crawls these data sources searching for keywords and relevant themes that we have defined in advance. We receive the results in the form of a dashboard that gives an overview of the previous 15 months. Meltwater anonymizes user data and does not make it available to us. You can find further information about data processing by Meltwater in the Meltwater privacy policy at: <a href="https://www.meltwater.com/en/privacy" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.meltwater.com/en/privacy</a>. The data processing is based on our legitimate interest (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR) in analyzing and managing our media coverage.</p><p><strong>Right to object </strong></p><p><strong>In section 1.3 we explain your right to object to the processing of your data on the basis of Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR. </strong></p><p>After this general information, we have provided you below with information about each individual offering:</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98528"><header><h3 class="">
                3.2 Facebook (Fan page)
            </h3></header><p>D端rr maintains a fan page on Facebook (for details of Facebook, see section 3.1 a)). .</p><p>The operator of Facebook is Meta Platforms, Inc. (<strong>Meta</strong>, formerly Facebook, Inc.), 1601 Willow Road, Menlo Park, CA 94025, USA. On the basis of the standard contractual clauses of the EU Commission, Facebook transfers personal data to Meta (for more information on third-country transfers, please refer to section 1.5).</p><p>The Facebook terms of service that you can find at the following link apply <a href="https://www.facebook.com/terms" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.facebook.com/terms</a>. You will find information about data collection and other processing by Facebook in Facebooks data policy: <a href="https://facebook.com/about/privacy/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://facebook.com/about/privacy/</a></p><p><strong>Facebook Insights: </strong>Whenever a user makes a visit to our fan page, some of the users personal data are collected, e.g. by using cookies. The data are collected primarily by Facebook. You can find details of how Facebook uses cookies in Facebooks cookie policy at: <a href="https://www.facebook.com/policies/cookies/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.facebook.com/policies/cookies/</a>. Visitors to our fan page who are not logged in or registered with Facebook are also recorded.</p><p>D端rr has no direct access to the data collected by Facebook. Instead, Facebook provides us only with highly summarized evaluations, e.g.:</p><ul><li>Followers: Number of people following D端rr, including the growth and development over a defined period.</li><li>Reach: Number of people who see a specific post. Number of interactions on a post. This indicates, for example, which content receives a better response from the community.</li><li>Ad performance: How many people have seen an ad?</li><li>Demographics: average age of visitors, gender, place of residence, language</li></ul><p>We use these statistics, which cannot be traced to any particular user, to constantly improve our online offering on Facebook and to better meet our users needs. The legal basis for these usage statistics is Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR.</p><p>We cannot connect the statistical data to any of our fans profile data. You can go to your Facebook settings to choose how targeted ads will be shown to you.</p><p>We have reached an agreement with Facebook concerning the joint responsibility under Art. 26 GDPR. You can find the agreement at the following link: <a href="https://www.facebook.com/legal/terms/page_controller_addendum" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.facebook.com/legal/terms/page_controller_addendum</a>. In the agreement, Facebook acknowledges the joint responsibility under data protection law with regard to the Insights data and complies with key obligations under data protection law (e.g. information from data subjects, data security and reporting breaches of data protection, main contact point for data subjects).</p><p>In this particular case, you can exercise your rights as a data subject as follows:</p><ul><li>If you have questions about the data collected by Facebook, please contact Facebook (you can find information about this in the Facebook data policy, see above).</li><li>If you have questions or concerns about the Insights data processed by D端rr, please contact our data protection officer (see section 2.1). You will find the remaining rights of data subjects in section 1.3.</li></ul></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98527"><header><h3 class="">
                3.3 Instagram
            </h3></header><p>D端rr has a presence on the Instagram service provided by Facebook.</p><p>The operator of Facebook is Meta (you can find details of Facebook, Meta, and data transfers in sections 3.1 a) and section 3.2).</p><p>The Instagram terms of use that you can find at the following link apply <a href="https://help.instagram.com/581066165581870" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://help.instagram.com/581066165581870</a>. You will find information about data collection and other processing by Facebook in Instagrams data policy: <a href="https://help.instagram.com/519522125107875" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://help.instagram.com/519522125107875</a>.</p><p><strong>Instagram Insights: </strong>Whenever a user makes a visit to our Instagram presence, some of the users personal data are collected, e.g. by using cookies. The data are collected primarily by Facebook. You can find details of how Facebook uses cookies in Facebooks cookie policy at: <a href="https://www.facebook.com/policies/cookies/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.facebook.com/policies/cookies/</a>. Visitors to our Instagram presence who are not logged in or registered with Instagram are also recorded.</p><p>We use the Instagram Insights function to obtain statistical evaluations of the readers of our posts. You can find details at: <a href="https://help.latest.instagram.com/788388387972460?helpref=hc_fnav" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://help.latest.instagram.com/788388387972460?helpref=hc_fnav</a>. D端rr has no direct access to the data collected by Facebook. Please note the additional information about Facebook Insights data in section 3.2, which also applies to Instagram.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98526"><header><h3 class="">
                3.4 LinkedIn
            </h3></header><p>D端rr maintains a presence on LinkedIn (for details of LinkedIn, see section 3.1 a)).</p><p>LinkedIn belongs to the LinkedIn Corporation, 1000 W Maude Ave, Sunnyvale, CA, USA. Therefore, data can be transferred to the USA (for more information on third-country transfers, please refer to section 1.5). This transfer is covered by the standard contractual clauses of the EU Commission.</p><p>You can find more information about data protection at LinkedIn in the LinkedIn privacy policy: <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/legal/privacy-policy" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.linkedin.com/legal/privacy-policy</a>. You will find the conditions of use of LinkedIn at: <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/legal/user-agreement" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.linkedin.com/legal/user-agreement</a>.</p><p>In accordance with the agreement that we have entered into with LinkedIn (available at <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/legal/l/dpa" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.linkedin.com/legal/l/dpa</a>), LinkedIn will inform us if a user exercises their rights as a data subject under Art. 15 to 22 GDPR. LinkedIn will help us to answer requests for information. You can exercise your rights (for more information, see section 1.3) against us and against LinkedIn.</p><p><strong>LinkedIn Page Analytics:</strong> In connection with our LinkedIn presence, we use LinkedIn Page Analytics. LinkedIn acknowledges its role as a joint controller (see the agreement that covers this and that is available at: <a href="https://legal.linkedin.com/pages-joint-controller-addendum" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://legal.linkedin.com/pages-joint-controller-addendum</a>). LinkedIn uses cookies, for example, to evaluate users behavior. From Page Analytics, we obtain information about the use of our content in the form of aggregated data that we cannot link to the profiles of our visitors. In the agreement referred to, LinkedIn accepts responsibility for the rights of data subjects. However, you can still contact us about this, as we explained in section 1.3.</p><p>For more information about how we use services from LinkedIn on our websites, please refer to section 2.7 a). You can object to LinkedIn processing your data for advertising purposes at the following link: <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/psettings/guest-controls/retargeting-opt-out" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.linkedin.com/psettings/guest-controls/retargeting-opt-out</a>.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98525"><header><h3 class="">
                3.5 YouTube
            </h3></header><p>D端rr has a channel on the YouTube platform provided by YouTube LLC (for more details, see section 3.1.a)), a subsidiary of Google LLC with headquarters in the USA.</p><p>Any Google service may transfer your data that has been collected by Google to the USA (for more information on third-country transfers, please refer to section 1.5). The transfer takes place on the basis of the standard contractual clauses of the EU Commission.</p><p><strong>YouTube Analytics:</strong> We receive statistics about the use of our channel, including the following aggregated and therefore anonymized information:</p><ul><li>Total number of video views</li><li>Average video views per person and trend (falling/rising and by how much)</li><li>Number of subscribers and trend</li><li>Number of visitors</li><li>Interactions from viewers (likes, comments, shared content)</li><li>Time visitors spent watching videos on the channel</li><li>Reach of videos</li><li>Percentage of videos that users watch on average</li></ul><p>Data are processed by the network operator on the basis of the terms of service (<a href="https://www.youtube.com/static?template=terms" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.youtube.com/static?template=terms</a>) and the Google privacy policy (<a href="https://policies.google.com/privacy" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://policies.google.com/privacy</a>). You can object to your data being processed by the network operator by changing the settings of your Google account here: <a href="https://adssettings.google.com/authenticated" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://adssettings.google.com/authenticated</a>. You can find information about managing the privacy settings of your Google account here: <a href="https://support.google.com/youtube/topic/9257518?hl=en&amp;ref_topic=9257107" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://support.google.com/youtube/topic/9257518?hl=en&amp;ref_topic=9257107</a>.</p><p>The agreement that we have reached with Google about our YouTube channel allows you to exercise your rights as a data subject against us (for more information, see section 1.3) and against Google.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98524"><header><h3 class="">
                3.6 Twitter
            </h3></header><p>D端rr has a presence on Twitter (for more details of Twitter, see section 3.1.a)).</p><p>Twitter belongs to Twitter Inc., 1355 Market Street, Suite 900, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA, and transfers data to the USA on the basis of the standard contractual clauses of the EU Commission (for more information on third-country transfers, please refer to section 1.5).</p><p>Twitter processes data on the basis of its terms of service (available at: <a href="https://twitter.com/en/tos" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://twitter.com/en/tos</a>) and the guidelines referred to there, in particular the Twitter privacy policy (available at: <a href="https://twitter.com/en/privacy" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://twitter.com/en/privacy</a>).</p><p>Twitter Analytics: We use the Twitter Analytics statistics service, which records the activities of visitors to our Twitter account and processes the data to provide us with statistics. This gives us details about how the subscribers and other visitors to our Twitter account read and use our tweets and which countries and cities they come from and also provides statistics about their gender ratios, age distribution, providers, and interests (accumulated). It is not possible to identify individual visitors (the exception to this is the monthly evaluation of the top follower and top mention).</p><p>In the agreement entered into with us (which you can access here: <a href="https://privacy.twitter.com/en/for-our-partners/global-dpa" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://privacy.twitter.com/en/for-our-partners/global-dpa</a>), Twitter has undertaken to inform us in the event of inquiries from data subjects relating to our Twitter presence. For information about the rights of data subjects, please refer to section 1.3.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98523"><header><h3 class="">
                3.7 Xing
            </h3></header><p>D端rr has a social media presence on Xing (for details of Xing, see section 3.1 a)).</p><p>You can find information about the way in which Xing processes your data (including the use of cookies and similar technologies) in the Xing general terms and conditions (available at: <a href="https://www.xing.com/terms" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.xing.com/terms</a>) and in the Xing privacy policy (<a href="https://privacy.xing.com/en/privacy-policy)" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://privacy.xing.com/en/privacy-policy)</a>.</p><p><strong>Analysis:</strong> We are provided with statistical evaluations (e.g. Xing BrandManager and Recruiter Insights) of the accesses to our Xing presence (including click paths). Xing uses third-party providers (e.g. Google, Adobe) for this purpose, and the data may be transferred to third countries that do not provide adequate data protection (for more information on third-country transfers, please refer to section 1.5 and on Google Analytics to section 2.6 a)). We cannot identify individual visitors using these aggregated data. We use the statistical evaluations to improve the attractiveness of our presence and to adapt it to the interests of our visitors.</p><p>If users are logged into their Xing profile when they access our Xing presence, information can be assigned to the profile. In addition, we can see the information from the user account. If you want to prevent this from happening, you should log out of your own Xing profile before you visit our Xing presence.</p><p>Xing provides information about other ways to object to tracking by Xing and its service providers under the following link: <a href="https://privacy.xing.com/en/privacy-policy/information-we-automatically-receive-through-your-use-of-xing/provision-of-our-service" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://privacy.xing.com/en/privacy-policy/information-we-automatically-receive-through-your-use-of-xing/provision-of-our-service</a>. To exercise your rights as a data subject, please refer to section 1.3.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98522"><header><h3 class="">
                3.8 Kununu
            </h3></header><p>D端rr has a social media presence on Kununu (for details of Kununu, see section 3.1 a)). Kununu belongs to Xing, and the basic conditions are the same in some cases (see section 3.7).</p><p>You can find information about the way in which Kununu processes your data (including the use of cookies and similar technologies) in the Xing privacy policy (see section 3.7), which also applies to Kununu. You can find the Kununu general terms and conditions at: <a href="https://www.kununu.com/de/info/agb" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.kununu.com/de/info/agb</a>.</p><p><strong>Analysis:</strong> We have access to statistical evaluations of accesses and activities on our Kununu presence. The information provided about Xing (section 3.7) also applies in this case. For information about the rights of data subjects, please refer to section 1.3.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98521"><header><h3 class="">
                3.9 Your rights as a data subject
            </h3></header><p>In section 1.3, we describe in detail the rights you have in relation to our processing of your data.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98520"><header><h2 class="">
                4. Privacy information relating to other data processing by companies in the D端rr Group not in connection with the websites
            </h2></header><p>Below you can find out what we do with your data in our business activities that are not connected with our websites. This section 4 applies in addition to the general information in section 1. If you cannot find the necessary information in this section 4, please refer to section 1 (e.g. concerning the rights of the data subject). If there is a conflict between section 4 and section 1, the information in section 4 takes precedence over section 1.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98519"><header><h3 class="">
                4.1 Who is the data controller with responsibility for processing data?
            </h3></header><p>This section covers data processing by the companies in the D端rr Group that are included in this <a href="/fileadmin/durr-group.com/Home/duerr-privacy-notice.pdf" target="_blank">list</a>, unless the processing is based on the provision of the website (in which case sections 2 and 5 apply).</p><p>In the annex, you will also find the contact details of the data controller (the company that you are in contact with) and its data protection officer.</p><p>Alternatively, if you have any questions or concerns relating to data protection, you can also contact the data protection officer of D端rr AG by email at <a href="javascript:linkTo_UnCryptMailto(%27jxfiql7axqxmolqbzqflkXaroo%2Bzlj%27);">dataprotection[at]durr.com</a> or by mail at</p><p>D端rr Aktiengesellschaft<br/> Attn: Data Protection Officer<br/> Carl-Benz-Str. 34<br/> 74321 Bietigheim-Bissingen<br/> Germany</p><p>In many cases that are described in detail here, two or more companies of the D端rr Group are joint controllers with responsibility for processing the data (see section 4.4, for example).</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98518"><header><h3 class="">
                4.2 Collection, storage and use of personal data
            </h3></header><p>If you enter into a contractual relationship with us (e.g. if you place an order for our goods and services or if we award a contract to your company) or if a contractual relationship with you is planned or if we make contact with or provide information to companies or if we carry out customer satisfaction studies or product surveys, we collect the following information:</p><ul><li>Master data (e.g. title, first name, last name, gender)</li><li>Communication data (e.g. business telephone number (landline and/or cell phone), valid email address, business mailing address)</li><li>Survey data (comments and evaluations provided by the customer) and log data (time stamp showing when the customer responded to the survey)</li><li>Data provided during the use of a training portal, e.g. participation details, evaluations, test results, and comments</li></ul><p>These data are collected:</p><ul><li>to be able to identify you or your company/your employer as our customer/potential customer for our services/supplier</li><li>to enter into a contractual relationship with you/your company/your employer</li><li>to fulfill the contract subsequently entered into with you/your company/your employer</li><li>to correspond with you for the purpose of entering into or fulfilling a contract</li><li>to issue invoices if a contractual relationship involving payment is entered into</li><li>to improve our customer service, services, and products</li><li>for marketing and advertising purposes</li><li>for the purposes of our legitimate interests</li></ul><p>The data are processed at your request or as part of customer satisfaction studies and product surveys, and the processing is necessary in accordance with Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR or Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (if you work for a company) for the specified purposes in order to enter into a contractual relationship and to allow both parties to fulfill their obligations under the contract that is subsequently concluded.</p><p>If you have given your consent to us processing your data for specific purposes, such as product advertising or marketing, this is based on Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR.</p><p>In addition, your personal data are processed for the purposes of our legitimate interests in accordance with Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR, including:</p><ul><li>to improve the D端rr Groups portfolio of products and services on your behalf</li><li>to produce statistical evaluations</li><li>to be able to pass your inquiry on to one of our distributors and to guarantee that the D端rr Group's IT systems and buildings are secure</li></ul><p>The personal data we collect are stored until the purposes listed above no longer apply and are then erased, unless we are required to store the data for a longer period in accordance with Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR on the basis of legal retention and documentation requirements (e.g. in the German Commercial Code, Criminal Code, or Fiscal Code) or unless you have consented to the data being stored for a longer period in accordance with Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98517"><header><h3 class="">
                4.3 Disclosure of your data
            </h3></header><p>Your personal data will not be transferred to third parties except for the purposes listed below.</p><p>If this is necessary in accordance with Art. 6(1)(b) GPDR (or in accordance with Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR if you are representing a company) for the purpose of fulfilling a contract that we have entered into with you, your personal data will be transferred to third parties. These include in particular companies in the D端rr Group or its partners that we use as shipping and payment service providers or portal operators for the performance of the contract.</p><p>The data that are transferred may be used by these third parties only for the specified purposes.</p><p>In accordance with Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR, your personal data can also be transferred to third parties that we use for the purposes of our legitimate interests as described in section 4.2 (including marketing service providers, distributors, consultants, agencies, companies from the D端rr Group).</p><p>If this is necessary for us to provide a service, your personal data, which we have your consent to use for the purposes in accordance with Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR, will be transferred to partners (including advertising and shipping service providers, D端rr Group companies).</p><p>If the recipients referred to above process your data outside the EEA, please refer to section 1.5.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98516"><header><h3 class="">
                4.4 Joint CRM system that we operate as a joint controller
            </h3></header><p>The companies in the D端rr Group operate a joint database (CRM system) and therefore act as joint controllers under the terms of Art. 26 GDPR.</p><p>You can find a list of the companies in the D端rr Group <a href="/fileadmin/durr-group.com/Home/duerr-privacy-notice.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>. The data are stored only as long as required for the purpose they were collected for or as required by law or if we have a legitimate interest in storing them, for example, law enforcement.</p><p>If the data are transferred to D端rr companies outside the EEA, this is based on the standard contractual clauses of the EU Commission. Please also refer to the information on third-country transfers in section 1.5.</p><p>The CRM system is provided by Salesforce. The data are stored in the EU. Data may be transferred to companies in the Salesforce Group outside the EEA (for details of Salesforce, see section 2.2 c)). </p><p>Internally we have drawn up a contract that divides the joint controller roles as follows: Data subjects can approach all joint controllers to exercise their rights as data subjects (for details of the rights of data subjects, see section 1.3).</p><p>The company in the D端rr Group that you provided your data to is your first point of contact. D端rr Systems AG is the controller responsible for the information obligations under Art. 13(f) GDPR and has overall responsibility for the CRM system. Within their scope of operations, the joint controllers are responsible for fulfilling the required reporting obligations and maintaining documentation; imposing confidentiality obligations on employees; explaining employees obligations under data protection law to them and ensuring the technical and organizational security of the data processing.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98515"><header><h3 class="">
                4.5 Your rights as a data subject
            </h3></header><p>In section 1.3, we describe in detail the rights you have in relation to our processing of your data.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98514"><header><h2 class="">
                5. Privacy information relating to the event website
            </h2></header><p>Below you can find out what we do with your data when you visit events.durr.com (our <strong>event website</strong>). This section 5 applies in <strong>addition </strong>to the general information in section 1. If you cannot find the necessary information in this section 5, please refer to section 1 (e.g. concerning the rights of the data subject).</p><p>If we refer to detailed information in sections 2 and 3 in the following, these sections also apply accordingly. If there is a conflict between section 5 and sections 1-3, the information in section 5 takes precedence over sections 1-3.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98513"><header><h3 class="">
                5.1 Who is the data controller with responsibility for processing data?
            </h3></header><p>The data controller responsible for data processing in connection with the event website is:</p><p>D端rr Systems Aktiengesellschaft<br/> Carl-Benz-Strae 34<br/> 74321 Bietigheim-Bissingen<br/> Telephone <a href="tel:+497142780">+49 71 42 78 0</a><br/> Fax <a href="tel:+497142781716">+49 71 42 78 17 16</a></p><p>If your event is not organized by D端rr Systems AG, but by another D端rr Group company (details of the organizer can be found in the invitation email or event announcement on this website, for example), D端rr Systems AG and the respective Group company (also referred to as the <strong>organizer</strong>) act as joint controllers. You can find the names of contacts and their contact information <a href="/fileadmin/durr-group.com/Home/duerr-privacy-notice.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</p><p>Internally we have divided up the joint controller roles as follows: Data subjects can approach both joint controllers to exercise their rights as data subjects (see Section 1.3). The organizer is responsible for the use of the contact information. D端rr Systems AG is the controller responsible for the information obligations under Art. 13(f) GDPR. Within their scope of operations, both joint controllers are responsible for fulfilling the required reporting obligations and maintaining documentation; imposing confidentiality obligations on employees; explaining employees obligations under data protection law to them and ensuring the technical and organizational security of the data processing.</p><p>Alternatively, you can also contact our data protection officer by email at <a href="javascript:linkTo_UnCryptMailto(%27jxfiql7axqxmolqbzqflkXaroo%2Bzlj%27);">dataprotection[at]durr.com</a> if you have any questions or concerns relating to data protection.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98512"><header><h3 class="">
                5.2 What personal data are collected and stored and for what purposes?
            </h3></header><p>On our event website, we organize digital networking events, product launches, presentations, discussion panels, meetings, and other events that visitors to our website can take part in (<strong>events</strong>).</p><p><strong>a) Visiting the event website </strong></p><p>When you use our event website, your personal data are logged, as described in section 2.2 a). The information there applies accordingly.</p><p><strong>Cookie management tool: </strong></p><p>On our event website, we also use the cookie management tool supplied by OneTrust, LLC (joint headquarters in the UK: Dixon House, 1 Lloyds Avenue, London, EC3N 3DQ; joint headquarters in the USA: 1200 Abernathy Rd NE, Building 600, Atlanta, GA 30328, USA, referred to in the following as <strong>OneTrust</strong>). The transfer of data is based on the standard contractual clauses of the EU Commission (for more information on third-country transfers, please refer to section 1.5).</p><p>Using the tool, we obtain your consent to store specific cookies on your device and document them in accordance with data protection legislation. You can also change your preferences at any time using the tool.</p><p>When you visit our website, a connection is made to the servers of OneTrust to obtain your consent and provide you with information about the use of cookies. Subsequently, OneTrust stores a cookie in your browser so that it can connect the consent you have granted and the withdrawal of this consent to you. The data that are collected in this way are stored until you ask us to erase them or erase the OneTrust cookie yourself or until the purpose for storing the data no longer applies. Any statutory obligations to store the data remain unaffected.</p><p>We use the OneTrust tool to obtain the consent required by law for the use of cookies. The legal basis for the processing of the consent is Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR. The use of the tools is based on our legitimate interest in using a specialist tool to provide transparent information about our cookies and about the management of website users consent (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR).</p><p>You can find more information about how OneTrust processes your data here <a href="https://www.onetrust.com/privacy-notice/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.onetrust.com/privacy-notice/</a>.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98511"><p><strong>b) Logging in and registering </strong></p><p><strong>(1) HubSpot:</strong><br/> In connection with our event website, we use customer management, content management and marketing services provided by the service provider HubSpot Ireland Limited, 2nd Floor, 30 North Wall Quay, Dublin 1, Ireland (<strong>HubSpot</strong>).</p><p><strong>(2) Microsoft:</strong><br/> We also use cloud services for contact management and in order to provide a simple solution for registering for all of our events (single sign-on) provided by Microsoft Ireland Operations Limited, 70 Sir Rogersons Quay, Dublin 2, Ireland (<strong>Microsoft</strong>, for more information see section 2.2 b)).</p><p><strong>We use the services of both HubSpot and Microsoft as follows: </strong>For certain content on our event website (e.g. participating in an event, download center), we offer you the option of logging in with a user name and password. Registration for these services takes place either after personal contact with our employees or after registering on our website using the registration form, with access subsequently being granted by one of our employees. The registration form is used to collect the following data, in particular:</p><ul><li>First name and last name, title</li><li>Company name</li><li>Position in the company</li><li>Email address</li><li>Any other information that you provide voluntarily, such as a photo, which you can upload, or your areas of interest.</li></ul><p>These data are stored on HubSpot servers and can be transferred to associated companies of HubSpot, including HubSpot Inc., in the USA. The same applies to Microsoft and associated companies of Microsoft (for details of Microsoft, see section 2 d)). The transfer of data is based on the standard contractual clauses of the EU Commission (for more information on third-country transfers, please refer to section 1.5). Please read HubSpots privacy policy carefully at <a href="https://legal.hubspot.com/privacy-policy" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">https://legal.hubspot.com/privacy-policy</a> for more information on data processing by HubSpot. During the registration process, we specifically inform you about the transfer of your data and the increased risk to your data associated with this and obtain your consent to this (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR), which you can withdraw at any time with future effect. Please note that participation/registration is not currently possible without this consent.</p><p>The legal basis for the processing of the data that you provide to us during registration is Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR for contracts that are implemented or, where there is no contract, Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR, and our legitimate interest, which is the same as the purpose of the processing, in other words, providing you with the information you requested and holding the event that you are interested in and have registered for. Participation without registration is not possible, because under some circumstances we provide confidential and internal company information via our website. We must ensure that this information is only accessed by authorized parties.</p><p>The data are erased as soon as they are no longer needed for the purpose they were collected for. For example, when the data are no longer required for the implementation of the contract. After the conclusion of the contract, it may be necessary to store the contractual partners personal data in order to comply with contractual or statutory obligations.</p><p>As a user, you can cancel your registration at any time. You can have your stored data modified at any time. Simply email us at <a href="javascript:linkTo_UnCryptMailto(%27jxfiql7fkclXaroo%2Bzlj%27);">info[at]durr.com</a>.</p><p>If the data are necessary for the performance of a contract or for steps prior to entering into a contract, premature erasure of the data is only possible if this is not prevented by contractual or statutory obligations.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98510"><p><strong>c) Contact options, chat function </strong></p><p>We offer you various contact options, e.g. contact via the email addresses provided, a chat function, and a contact form, for certain functions of our website (e.g. inquiries from customers, visitors, or the press).</p><p>We use the services of HubSpot in this connection as well (see section 5.2 b)). The data transferred via the contact form or chat function, and the fact of its use, and the users data transferred in the email are stored. This includes the participants in the chat, the time and content of the messages, the users, and the forms they used. HubSpot evaluates this information in aggregated form against the total number of uses of the respective form.</p><p>We use your data solely to process your request and can contact you for this purpose using the contact data provided. The legal basis for processing data that are transferred in the course of contacting us is Art. 6 (1)(f) GDPR and our legitimate interest in responding to the inquiry. If the aim of making contact is to enter into a contract, then the legal basis for processing is Art. 6 (1)(b) GDPR.</p><p>The data are erased as soon as they are no longer needed for the purpose they were collected for. The personal data that you have sent to us for the purpose of making contact will be erased once the relevant conversation with you has come to an end. The conversation is deemed to have ended when it is clear from the circumstances that the matter in question has been conclusively resolved. We generally store the written transcript of the chat together with the conference for a period of four weeks after the chat occurred only insofar as separate erasure from the conference recording is not possible. However, under some circumstances we are entitled and, in some cases, obligated to store the data for longer, e.g. due to a statutory documentation obligation.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98509"><p><strong>d) Video and audio chats and video conferences (e.g. webinars or presentations) </strong></p><p>As a registered user of our website on the basis of Art. 6 (1)(b) GDPR, when you log in to the website you can visit dedicated chatrooms for your event, where you can speak to our employees, the moderators, and other guests. Additionally, on our website we offer the option of participating in video conferences of various types (e.g. webinars, presentations, panel discussions, networking events).</p><p><strong>(1) Microsoft:</strong><br/> In this area, we work with a third-party provider, depending on the format and technology, such as Microsoft and its Teams video conference service. Please note the following information: Microsoft processes the personal data of the visitors to the events, which we organize using Microsoft Teams, as our processor (we remain the controller responsible for the processing). However, Microsoft also processes some data (e.g. data generated by cookies for measuring the use of the services or other telemetry data) for its own business purposes (e.g. invoicing and account management), for Microsoft internal reporting and business modeling (e.g. forecasts, revenue, capacity planning, product strategy), combating fraud, and improving core functionality. This applies regardless of whether or not you yourself have a Microsoft user account and whether or not you are logged in. Microsoft is a subsidiary of Microsoft Corporation in the USA. It is therefore possible that your data may be transferred to a data center in the USA. The transfer is based on the standard contractual clauses of the EU Commission and on additional assurances made by Microsoft to the users. Please refer to the general Microsoft privacy policy at https://privacy.microsoft.com/en-US. We base our use of services such as Teams and the processing of the provider associated with this for its own limited purposes on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR and our legitimate interest in holding the events in digital form.</p><p><strong>(2) b&amp;b Digital GmbH:</strong><br/> To live stream an event, we use the service provided by b&amp;b Digital GmbH (<strong>b&amp;b</strong>). b&amp;b processes the personal data of the visitors to our events, where we use the streaming service of b&amp;b, as our processor (we remain the controller responsible for the processing). b&amp;b collects the following personal data: Login and logout are stored with the time stamp, name and IP address. Additionally, the streams may be recorded (see Recordings). We base our use of the streaming service of b&amp;b and the processing associated with this on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR and our legitimate interest in holding the events in digital form.</p><p><strong>(3) Sli.do:</strong><br/> We use the chat function of the service provider sli.do s. r. o., Vajnorsk叩 100/A, 831 04 Bratislava, Slovakia (slido), which is part of the Cisco Systems Inc. Group and which, as our processor, processes personal data of the participants (e.g. name, email, company), as well as data shared by the participants with other participants via the service (e.g. questions, ideas, chat messages). We base our use of slidos service and the processing associated with this on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR and our legitimate interest in communicating with the participants while holding the events in digital form. If slido transfers the data to third countries, this transfer is based on standard contractual clauses. </p><p><strong>(4) Vimeo:</strong><br/> For the purposes of video streaming, we use the services of Vimeo, LLC, 555 West 18th Street, New York, New York 10011, USA (Vimeo). When you view the video stream, information (including your IP address, time stamp, browser, operating system, device information, use behavior, etc.) is sent directly to the Vimeo servers and transferred to the USA. If you are logged into Vimeo, Vimeo can directly associate your visit to our website with your Vimeo account.</p><p>In accordance with Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR, our data processing is based on your consent, which you give when you register and can withdraw at any time with future effect. Your consent includes the transfer of your personal data to the USA.</p><p>If you do not want Vimeo to directly associate the data collected via our website with your Vimeo account, you must log out of Vimeo before visiting our website. Please consult the Vimeo privacy policy for information about the purpose and scope of the data collection by Vimeo and the additional processing and use of the data by Vimeo: <a href="http://vimeo.com/privacy" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank">http://vimeo.com/privacy</a>.</p><p><strong>Recordings: </strong><br/> In individual cases, a recording may be made of the chat, your participation, or your spoken message. By switching on your camera or your microphone and participating in our event, you consent (in accordance with Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR) to the recording of your image and/or your voice. If you do not want your voice or image to be recorded, you can withdraw your consent at any time by switching off your camera and/or your microphone. Please note that withdrawal does not affect the lawfulness of any processing that had already occurred. Even if you switch off your microphone and/or your camera, it is possible to ask questions in writing, either during the event or afterwards. We store the chats for a period of four weeks after they were recorded, unless separate erasure from the conference recording is not possible, e.g. because you asked a question during a conference and your spoken message was recorded along with the conference. Depending on the event, we keep the recording of the event accessible on the Internet for as long as we deem reasonable. However, under some circumstances we are entitled and, in some cases, obligated to store the data for longer, e.g. due to a statutory documentation obligation.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98508"><p><strong>e) Advertising messages (e.g. email newsletters, invitations) </strong></p><p>You can register on our website for advertising messages from D端rr AG (e.g. newsletters) to obtain more detailed information about our offering or to receive invitations to future events. For details, please refer to section 2.8.</p><p><strong>Future invitations (tracking) </strong></p><p>If you also want to be invited to our events in the future, you can register for the corresponding information service, which is also provided by our service provider HubSpot (for details of HubSpot, see Section 5.2.b)).</p><p><strong>HubSpot Tracking</strong></p><p>The invitation emails sent by HubSpot on our behalf contain a tracking pixel, which transfers information to HubSpot when you open the email. We receive this information from HubSpots servers to generate statistical analyses, to measure the success of our invitations, and to check whether you were invited, when you register for a future event. The tracking pixel in the emails is used to track whether the email or a link in the email was opened and also, in some cases, for how long. If an email is sent to multiple recipients, it is not possible to know who opened the email/link, but only that the email or link was opened by one of the addressees. This information is also used to produce anonymized analyses, statistics, and evaluations.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98507"><header><h3 class="">
                5.3 Cookies 
            </h3></header><p>We use cookies on our website. For details, please refer to section 2.3, which also applies to the event website.</p><p>The following cookies in particular are used on the event website.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-spreadsheets_table frame-layout-0" id="c98506"><div class="spreadsheet-table-responsive"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="spreadsheet-table" id="spreadsheet-98506"><tbody><tr class="header"><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-15" data-title="Name of cookie">
				Name of cookie
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-15" data-title="Type of cookie">
				Type of cookie
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-15" data-title="Name of application">
				Name of application
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-15" data-title="Purpose of cookie">
				Purpose of cookie
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-15" data-title="Storage duration">
				Storage duration
			</td></tr><tr><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-16" data-title="Name of cookie">
				__hstc
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Type of cookie">
				Technically required
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Name of application">
				Webinar assignment (HubSpot)
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Purpose of cookie">
				To check whether a user is entitled to take part in an event, it is necessary for the user to be recognized. For this purpose, the cookie contains the domain, the user token (utk), the first time stamp (of the first visit), the last time stamp (of the last visit), the current time stamp (of this visit), and the number of sessions (increases with every subsequent session).
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Storage duration">
				13 months
			</td></tr><tr><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-16" data-title="Name of cookie">
				hubspotutk
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Type of cookie">
				Technically required
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Name of application">
				Webinar assignment (HubSpot)
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Purpose of cookie">
				This cookie tracks the identity of a user. It is transferred to the HubSpot software when a form is submitted and used to de-duplicate contacts (in other words, to merge identical data sets) in order to prevent a new data set being added for a user every time they access a platform.
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Storage duration">
				13 months
			</td></tr><tr><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-16" data-title="Name of cookie">
				__hssc
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Type of cookie">
				Technically required
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Name of application">
				Webinar assignment (HubSpot)
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Purpose of cookie">
				This cookie is used to determine whether the HubSpot software needs to increase the number of sessions and the time stamp in the __hstc cookie (see this cookie).
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Storage duration">
				30 minutes
			</td></tr><tr><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-17" data-title="Name of cookie">
				__hssrc
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Type of cookie">
				Technically required
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Name of application">
				Webinar assignment (HubSpot)
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Purpose of cookie">
				Whenever the HubSpot software changes the session cookie, this cookie is stored. It is used to determine whether the user has restarted the browser.
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Storage duration">
				Until the end of the session
			</td></tr><tr><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-16" data-title="Name of cookie">
				__cfruid
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Type of cookie">
				Technically required
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Name of application">
				Cloudflare
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Purpose of cookie">
				This cookie is used by Cloudflare to guarantee confidential access. All cookies stored by other websites are ignored during the access.
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Storage duration">
				12 months
			</td></tr><tr><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-16" data-title="Name of cookie">
				Optanonconsent
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Type of cookie">
				Technically required
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Name of application">
				Cookie compliance tool (OneTrust)
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Purpose of cookie">
				This cookie is stored by the OneTrust cookie compliance solution. It stores information about the categories of cookies that the website uses and about whether users have given or withdrawn their consent to the use of every category.
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Storage duration">
				12 months
			</td></tr><tr><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-16" data-title="Name of cookie">
				OptanonAlertBoxClosed
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Type of cookie">
				Technically required
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Name of application">
				Cookie compliance tool (OneTrust)
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Purpose of cookie">
				This cookie is used to determine whether the banner should be displayed to the user or whether the user has already confirmed this.
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-13" data-title="Storage duration">
				12 months
			</td></tr><tr><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-16" data-title="Name of cookie">
				li_fat_id

			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Name of application">
				LinkedIn

				For storing the relay cookie.
			</td><td class="cell cell-type-s cell-style-14" data-title="Storage duration">
				End of the browser session
			</td></tr></tbody></table></div></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98505"><header><h3 class="">
                5.4 Disclosure of your data
            </h3></header><p>We can disclose your data to third parties as described in section 1.2.</p><p>We can also disclose your data to our IT service providers that help us to provide the website, send invitations, hold events, etc. (e.g. Microsoft, HubSpot, and Thema AG, which helped us to set up the website).</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98504"><header><h3 class="">
                5.5 Integration and use of social networks and map services (cookies, plugins, and hyperlinks)
            </h3></header><p>Please refer to sections 2.4 and 2.5, which also apply to the event website, for information about the integration (e.g. via links and plugins) by us and the integration of map services. You can find privacy information relating to our use of social networks in section 3.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98503"><header><h3 class="">
                5.6 Use of analysis and marketing services
            </h3></header><p>Please refer to sections 2.6 and 2.7, which also apply to the event website, for information about use of analysis and marketing services.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98502"><header><h3 class="">
                5.7 Your rights as a data subject
            </h3></header><p>In section 1.3, we describe in detail the rights you have in relation to our processing of your data.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98501"><header><h2 class="">
                6. Privacy information relating to job applications
            </h2></header><p>Below you can find out what we do with your data when you send us a job application. This section 6 applies in addition to the general information in section 1. If you cannot find the necessary information in this section 6, please refer to section 1 (e.g. concerning the rights of the data subject).</p><p>If we refer to detailed information in sections 1-5 in the following, these sections also apply. If there is a conflict between section 6 and sections 1-5, the information in section 6 takes precedence over sections 1-5.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98500"><header><h3 class="">
                6.1 Who is the data controller with responsibility for processing data?
            </h3></header><p>This section 6 covers data processing relating to your job application by the companies in the D端rr Group that are included in this list, unless the processing is based on the provision of the website (in which case sections 2 and 5 apply). The company that you apply to is always the controller responsible for processing your application data. In the list under the link, you will find the contact details of the controller and the relevant data protection officer. Alternatively, if you have any questions or concerns relating to data protection, you can also contact the data protection officer of D端rr AG by email at <a href="javascript:linkTo_UnCryptMailto(%27jxfiql7axqxmolqbzqflkXaroo%2Bzlj%27);">dataprotection[at]durr.com</a> or by mail at</p><p>D端rr Aktiengesellschaft<br/> Attn: Data Protection Officer<br/> Carl-Benz-Str. 34<br/> 74321 Bietigheim-Bissingen<br/> Germany</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98499"><header><h3 class="">
                6.2 Collection, storage and use of personal data
            </h3></header><p>When you apply to a company in the D端rr Group, you provide the company with your personal data for the purposes of a job application, because you are looking for a job. Your data will be stored and processed on the IT systems of our external provider of recruitment management services.</p><p>During the application process, we collect the following information:</p><ul><li>Master data (e.g. title, first name, last name, date of birth, place of residence)</li><li>Documents (e.g. references, certificates, CV, motivation letter)</li><li>Data for paying travel expenses (e.g. bank details)</li><li>Communication data (e.g. phone number (landline and/or cell phone), email address, mailing address)</li><li>Log data generated during the use of the IT systems</li></ul><p>The data are processed at your request and in relation to your application, and the processing is necessary in accordance with Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR in order to enter into a contractual relationship and to allow both parties to fulfill their obligations under the employment contract that may subsequently be concluded. Within the D端rr Group company that you apply to, only the people and departments involved in the recruitment process (e.g. managers and employees who are involved in the recruitment process from the technical department and HR and employee representatives) have access to your personal data.</p><p>If you have also given your consent to us processing your data for specific purposes, this is based on Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR. In addition, your personal data are processed for the purposes of our legitimate interests in accordance with Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR, among other things to produce anonymized statistical evaluations.</p><p>The personal data we collect are stored until the purposes listed above no longer apply and are then erased, unless we are required to store the data for a longer period in accordance with Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR on the basis of legal retention and documentation requirements (e.g. in the German Commercial Code, Criminal Code, or Fiscal Code) or unless you have consented to the data being stored for a longer period in accordance with Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98498"><header><h3 class="">
                6.3 Disclosure of your data
            </h3></header><p>Your personal data will not be transferred to third parties except for the purposes listed below.</p><p>The data from your application can be transferred within the D端rr Group in relation to another job advertisement in accordance with Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR if you are a match for the other job and if you have given your consent to your data being transferred for this purpose.</p><p>To take steps prior to entering into a contract as part of the recruitment process, your data will be transferred to third parties in accordance with Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR. These include our external provider of recruitment management services. The data that are transferred may be used by these third parties only for the specified purposes.</p><p>For the purposes of the legitimate interests referred to in section 6.2 in accordance with Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR, your personal data will only be transferred to our external provider of recruitment management services for the creation of anonymized statistical evaluations.</p><p>If the recipients referred to above process your data outside the EEA, please refer to section 1.5.</p></div><div class="frame frame-default frame-type-text frame-layout-0" id="c98497"><header><h3 class="">
                6.4 Your rights as a data subject
            </h3></header><p>In section 1.3, we describe in detail the rights you have in relation to our processing of your data.</p></div></div></div></div>
<!--TYPO3SEARCH_end-->
